item.title: Stop Hand-Crafting Tokens
item.description: Stop using hard-coded tokens like it's 2007: A deep dive into securing microservices with OAuth 2.0 Client Credentials and the magic of JWKS key rotation.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: Stop Making Your S3 Buckets Public! A Guide to Presigned URLs
item.description: Learn how to use S3 Presigned URLs to securely share private files without ever making your bucket public.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: InfoSec Architect 102-Service Accounts in the Linux Universe
item.description: This hands-on guide walks you through setting up Kerberos and LDAP on Ubuntu to achieve secure, password-free database access for service accounts, inspired by real-world practices at Uber.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: From Zero to Zero Trust: Securing Microservices with SPIFFE (The Fun Way!)
item.description: This post uses a hands-on Go demo to show how SPIFFE/SPIRE automates Zero Trust security for gRPC microservices.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: Hacker and Physicist - A Tale of "Common Sense"
item.description: Why fundamental digital principles are as invisible (and essential) as the laws of physics.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: A Look Back at WeChat's PhxSQL and the 'Fastest Majority'
item.description: This post explores how WeChat's PhxSQL uses the "Fastest Majority" principle to offer a timeless lesson in designing fast and resilient distributed database systems.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: An InfoSec Architect's First Taste of Temporal
item.description: This is a therapy session for anyone traumatized by fragile scripts. I traded my `cron/try/catch` nightmares for a robot project manager named Temporal.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: Consensus Algorithms Through the Eyes of an Infosec Architect
item.description: a.k.a. I wrote a Raft cluster in Go and accidentally learned a lot
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.description: Service accounts may sound boring, but theyâ€™re the unsung heroes of secure automation. In this post, we time-travel back to the prehistoric age of Windows domains to see how service accounts and Kerberos work together to avoid hardcoded passwords and security nightmares.

item.title: AWS Security Specialty: What I Learned Preparing for the Exam
item.description: Sharing my exam prep insights and key technical focus areas like IAM, KMS, and VPC to help others prepare for the AWS Security Specialty exam.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: Envelope Encryption: Boosting Cloud Security with KMS
item.description: Explore envelope encryption and its importance for cloud security, using AWS Key Management Service (KMS) and OpenSSL to protect sensitive data.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: Encrypting DynamoDB with AWS KMS: A Secure and Easy Guide
item.description: Discover how to use Terraform and AWS Key Management Service (KMS) to encrypt DynamoDB tables and enhance cybersecurity.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: Bastion Hosts: Safeguarding Your Cloud Resources

item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: ABAC and RBAC: A Journey with Terraform and AWS Tagged Resources
item.description: Exploring the nuances of Attribute-based Access Control (ABAC) and Role-based Access Control (RBAC) in cloud security using Terraform, and understanding their strategic implementation in managing AWS tagged resources.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: An IAM Split-Privilege Model with Terraform for Robust Cybersecurity
item.description: A practical (and funny) guide to implementing a split-privilege model in AWS. We'll separate the power to create permissions from the power to assign them, making your cloud a whole lot safer.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)

item.title: Harnessing AWS IAM and Terraform for Enhanced Cybersecurity
item.description: An old-timer's guide to using Terraform to manage who gets to touch what in your AWS account. Learn about IAM users, policies, groups, and roles without falling asleep.
item.author: nerd@supasaf.com (Supa Safe)
